intro: Persoonia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited pear-plant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Persoonia microcarpa is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pink, and it plays a role in supporting local wildlife by providing nectar for birds and insects.
